block.p: Emily Elizabeth Baldwin and John Douglas Augustine were married yesterday in Rye, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel Love performed the ceremony at Rye Presbyterian Church.

Mrs. Augustine, 32, is an account supervisor at Stanton Crenshaw Communications, a public relations and marketing firm in New York. She graduated from Columbia University and is a candidate for a master's degree in tourism and travel management at New York University. Her father, David A. Baldwin of New York, is the Ira D. Wallach professor of world order studies at the Columbia University Institute of War and Peace Studies. Her mother, Marilyn Austin of Hanover, N.H., is the director of special education at Fair Haven High School in Fair Haven, Vt.
Emily Elizabeth Baldwin and John Douglas Augustine were married yesterday in Rye, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel Love performed the ceremony at Rye Presbyterian Church.

Mrs. Augustine, 32, is an account supervisor at Stanton Crenshaw Communications, a public relations and marketing firm in New York. She graduated from Columbia University and is a candidate for a master's degree in tourism and travel management at New York University. Her father, David A. Baldwin of New York, is the Ira D. Wallach professor of world order studies at the Columbia University Institute of War and Peace Studies. Her mother, Marilyn Austin of Hanover, N.H., is the director of special education at Fair Haven High School in Fair Haven, Vt.

Mr. Augustine, 34, works at Andersen Consulting in New York as a management consultant to retail companies. He graduated magna cum laude from Swarthmore College and received an M.B.A. from Harvard. He is a son of Sara Augustine of Wilmington, Del., and the late Mark E. Augustine Jr. His mother retired as an administrative assistant at Emily Bissell Hospital in Wilmington. His father was a computer systems analyst in Wilmington for Hercules Inc., the chemicals company.
